fuss.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things
fuss.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: James said he’d better be getting back or there’d be a fuss.
The Steamatic enables you to clean any carpet with the minimum of fuss.
fuss.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: attention or excitement that is usually unnecessary or unwelcome
fuss.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: They wanted a quiet wedding without any fuss.
Until I heard her sing I couldn’t see what all the fuss was about (=why people liked it so much).
fuss.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to worry a lot about things that may not be very important
fuss.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I wish you’d stop fussing – I’ll be perfectly all right.
fuss.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to pay too much attention to small unimportant details
fuss.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Paul was fussing with his clothes, trying to get his tie straight.
fuss.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to behave in an unhappy or angry way
fuss.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The baby woke up and started to fuss.
